title: La Bohème
description: A passionate, timeless, and indelible story of love among young artists in Paris, has a special place in the repertoire because of its ability to communicate directly to audiences and move them to tears.

reviews.quote: Innovative staging that brings new life to this classic opera.
reviews.author: New York Times

reviews.quote: Madison's vision for La Bohème is both respectful of tradition and refreshingly modern.
reviews.author: Opera Today

title: The Ghosts of Versailles
description: This grand opera buffa blends historical figures with fictional characters from Beaumarchais's 'The Guilty Mother.' Marie Antoinette and the ghosts of Versailles watch a new opera by the ghost of Beaumarchais that he hopes will alter history and save the queen from execution.

reviews.quote: A visually stunning production that captures the opera's blend of history and fantasy with remarkable clarity.
reviews.author: Opera News

reviews.quote: Madison's direction brings fresh insight to Corigliano's complex masterpiece, balancing comedy and pathos with a deft touch.
reviews.author: The New York Times

title: Queen of Spades
description: Based on Pushkin's short story, Tchaikovsky's psychological thriller follows an army officer whose obsession with learning a gambling secret leads to madness and tragedy. This production explores the dark corners of obsession, love, and fate.

reviews.quote: A haunting interpretation that reveals new layers of Tchaikovsky's masterwork.
reviews.author: Chicago Tribune

reviews.quote: Madison's direction brings psychological depth to this tale of obsession and fate.
reviews.author: Opera Magazine
